column4: The memtest tells me there are 78 errors on test 3 and hangs up on test 4 ... if I swap the ram wouldn't this fix the problem??
sounds like your ram is faulty, run the test again to see if its peplicatable, if so. new ram
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=898281
can you please give a pastebin of the output of: dpkg -l | grep flash; dpkg -l | grep gnash; dpkg -l | grep swf
go to the link above, put the text in the page, add your name, click paste, when the page changes, copy the new address in the address bar and paste it here
use http://pastebin.com
... how does that website work?
copy the text, paste it on the site, add your name, click paste, when the page changes, copy the new address in the address bar and paste it here
ok thats way too many. run this:
thank you ... I really appreciate your help!

sudo apt-get --purge remove adobe-flashplugin flashplugin-installer flashplugin-nonfree gnash gnash-common; sudo apt-get --purge autoremove; sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install flashplugin-nonfree
you may get issues with adobe-flashplugin but we'll cross that bridge if we need to
I am learning ... as you can see I got some errors on the remove command.
ok pastebin them lets see what it says
http://pastebin.com/m3b1341e2
groovy: sudo dpkg --force-all -i /var/cache/apt/archives/adobe-flashplugin_10.0.32.18-1intrepid1_i386.deb; sudo apt-get -f install; sudo apt-get --purge remove adobe-flashplugin
http://pastebin.com/m5e9828a2
It seems to be the same error every time ....
not sure then, sounds like you will need to redownload the deb file again
you could try websearching the error (copy all the lines) and see what comes up
run it from terminal, websearch for the output
